recipe.title: How to Make Anzac Biscuits
recipe.intro: Anzac Biscuits are traditional Australian cookies made with oats and golden syrup. They have a long history from World War I.
recipe.ingredients: rolled oats, plain flour, desiccated coconut, brown sugar, butter, golden syrup, bicarbonate of soda, boiling water
steps: **Mix** the oats, flour, coconut, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
**Melt** the butter and golden syrup together in a small pot.
**Dissolve** the bicarbonate of soda in boiling water and **add** it to the butter mixture.
**Pour** the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and **stir** well.
**Roll** small balls of dough and **place** them on a baking tray. **Bake** for 15 minutes until golden.

review.text: I stopped by Rusty's Market CafÃ© this morning. It is inside the famous Rusty's Markets. I bought two Anzac biscuits and a long black. The biscuits were chewy and had a lovely golden syrup flavour. They reminded me of my grandmother's recipe. The cafÃ© also sells fresh tropical fruit and homemade treats. It is a great spot to visit on a Saturday morning. The biscuits were only three dollars each, which is good value!

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Good morning! Welcome to Rusty's Market CafÃ©.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Morning! Those biscuits look yummy. What are they?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: They are Anzac biscuits. They are made with oats, coconut, and golden syrup.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Oh, I love Anzac biscuits! Are they chewy or crunchy?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: These ones are chewy. We bake them fresh every morning.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Great! Can I have three, please? I want to share with my friends.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Of course! Three Anzac biscuits. Anything to drink?

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Yes, a long black, please. No sugar.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Sure! That is twelve dollars altogether.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Yes, just tap here. Thank you! Enjoy your biscuits and coffee!

part_a.full_text: Grandma, can you teach me how to make Anzac biscuits? Of course, darling. First, you need rolled oats and coconut. Do we have golden syrup? Yes, it is in the cupboard. How long do I bake them? About fifteen minutes until they are golden. Can I eat one now? Wait until they cool down a little bit! They smell so good!

gaps.before: First, you need rolled oats and

part_b.full_text: Attention, everyone! Our school is having a bake sale next Friday. We need volunteers to bake cookies, cakes, and biscuits. All money from the sale will go to the local animal shelter. We need at least fifty items to sell. Please bring your baked goods to the school hall by nine o'clock in the morning. The sale will run from ten o'clock to two o'clock. If you can help, please sign up at the front office. Thank you!

try_it.example: In Japan, we have a sweet called mochi. It is made from rice. People eat mochi on New Year's Day. It is soft and chewy!
